thread.title: Leeds Rhinos star surprises 10-year-old superfan who raised £7,000 for charity
thread.title_full: Leeds Rhinos star surprises 10-year-old superfan who raised £7,000 for charity | Calendar - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Leeds Rhinos star surprises 10-year-old superfan who raised £7,000 for charity
text:
A 10-year-old rugby fan who raised more than £7,000 by running 60 miles over four days has been visited by a Leeds Rhinos star.
Megan Rodd's latest fundraiser saw her run from Leeds to Warrington and came after a series of stunts in aid of charities including the Teenage Cancer Trust.
Her efforts caught the attention of the Junction 32 shopping park, which organised for Rhinos player Jamie Jones-Buchanan to visit her as part of its Christmas Wish campaign.
He dropped by at Megan's Dewsbury home to give her a signed shirt and a shopping voucher from Junction 32.
Shell Rodd, Megan's mum, entered a competition to have her daughter's rugby league wish granted.
She filled up when she answered the door to Jamie – I’ve never seen her react like that before.
She was beaming for the rest of the day and can’t wait to tell all her friends when she’s back at school after half term.
– Shell Rodd, Megan’s mum I couldn’t believe it when I opened the door and it was Jamie. It was funny to have him at my house sat on the sofa. I’m a massive fan and love going to watch him play, he’s even my screensaver on my phone.
– Megan Rodd Last updated Fri 17 Feb 2017 West Yorkshire Leeds
